abr.name: Abridger
abr.note: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by shortening or condensing the original work but leaving the nature and content of the original work substantially unchanged. For substantial modifications that result in the creation of a new work, see author

act.name: Actor
act.note: A performer contributing to an expression of a work by acting as a cast member or player in a musical or dramatic presentation, etc.

adp.name: Adapter
adp.note: A person or organization who 1) reworks a musical composition, usually for a different medium, or 2) rewrites novels or stories for motion pictures or other audiovisual medium.

rcp.name: Addressee
rcp.note: A person, family, or organization to whom the correspondence in a work is addressed

anl.name: Analyst
anl.note: A person or organization that reviews, examines and interprets data or information in a specific area

anm.name: Animator
anm.note: A person contributing to a moving image work or computer program by giving apparent movement to inanimate objects or drawings. For the creator of the drawings that are animated, see artist

ann.name: Annotator
ann.note: A person who makes manuscript annotations on an item

apl.name: Appellant
apl.note: A person or organization who appeals a lower court's decision

ape.name: Appellee
ape.note: A person or organization against whom an appeal is taken

app.name: Applicant
app.note: A person or organization responsible for the submission of an application or who is named as eligible for the results of the processing of the application (e.g., bestowing of rights, reward, title, position)

arc.name: Architect
arc.note: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating an architectural design, including a pictorial representation intended to show how a building, etc., will look when completed. It also oversees the construction of structures

arr.name: Arranger
arr.note: A person, family, or organization contributing to a musical work by rewriting the composition for a medium of performance different from that for which the work was originally intended, or modifying the work for the same medium of performance, etc., such that the musical substance of the original composition remains essentially unchanged. For extensive modification that effectively results in the creation of a new musical work, see composer

acp.name: Art copyist
acp.note: A person (e.g., a painter or sculptor) who makes copies of works of visual art

adi.name: Art director
adi.note: A person contributing to a motion picture or television production by overseeing the artists and craftspeople who build the sets

art.name: Artist
art.note: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a work by conceiving, and implementing, an original graphic design, drawing, painting, etc. For book illustrators, prefer Illustrator [ill]

ard.name: Artistic director
ard.note: A person responsible for controlling the development of the artistic style of an entire production, including the choice of works to be presented and selection of senior production staff

asg.name: Assignee
asg.note: A person or organization to whom a license for printing or publishing has been transferred

asn.name: Associated name
asn.note: A person or organization associated with or found in an item or collection, which cannot be determined to be that of a Former owner [fmo] or other designated relationship indicative of provenance

att.name: Attributed name
att.note: An author, artist, etc., relating him/her to a resource for which there is or once was substantial authority for designating that person as author, creator, etc. of the work

auc.name: Auctioneer
auc.note: A person or organization in charge of the estimation and public auctioning of goods, particularly books, artistic works, etc.

aut.name: Author
aut.note: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a work that is primarily textual in content, regardless of media type (e.g., printed text, spoken word, electronic text, tactile text) or genre (e.g., poems, novels, screenplays, blogs). Use also for persons, etc., creating a new work by paraphrasing, rewriting, or adapting works by another creator such that the modification has substantially changed the nature and content of the original or changed the medium of expression

aqt.name: Author in quotations or text abstracts
aqt.note: A person or organization whose work is largely quoted or extracted in works to which he or she did not contribute directly. Such quotations are found particularly in exhibition catalogs, collections of photographs, etc.

aft.name: Author of afterword, colophon, etc.
aft.note: A person or organization responsible for an afterword, postface, colophon, etc. but who is not the chief author of a work

aud.name: Author of dialog
aud.note: A person or organization responsible for the dialog or spoken commentary for a screenplay or sound recording

aui.name: Author of introduction, etc.
aui.note: A person or organization responsible for an introduction, preface, foreword, or other critical introductory matter, but who is not the chief author

ato.name: Autographer
ato.note: A person whose manuscript signature appears on an item

ant.name: Bibliographic antecedent
ant.note: A person or organization responsible for a resource upon which the resource represented by the bibliographic description is based. This may be appropriate for adaptations, sequels, continuations, indexes, etc.

bnd.name: Binder
bnd.note: A person who binds an item

bdd.name: Binding designer
bdd.note: A person or organization responsible for the binding design of a book, including the type of binding, the type of materials used, and any decorative aspects of the binding

blw.name: Blurb writer
blw.note: A person or organization responsible for writing a commendation or testimonial for a work, which appears on or within the publication itself, frequently on the back or dust jacket of print publications or on advertising material for all media

bkd.name: Book designer
bkd.note: A person or organization involved in manufacturing a manifestation by being responsible for the entire graphic design of a book, including arrangement of type and illustration, choice of materials, and process used

bkp.name: Book producer
bkp.note: A person or organization responsible for the production of books and other print media

bjd.name: Bookjacket designer
bjd.note: A person or organization responsible for the design of flexible covers designed for or published with a book, including the type of materials used, and any decorative aspects of the bookjacket

bpd.name: Bookplate designer
bpd.note: A person or organization responsible for the design of a book owner's identification label that is most commonly pasted to the inside front cover of a book

bsl.name: Bookseller
bsl.note: A person or organization who makes books and other bibliographic materials available for purchase. Interest in the materials is primarily lucrative

brl.name: Braille embosser
brl.note: A person, family, or organization involved in manufacturing a resource by embossing Braille cells using a stylus, special embossing printer, or other device

brd.name: Broadcaster
brd.note: A person, family, or organization involved in broadcasting a resource to an audience via radio, television, webcast, etc.

cll.name: Calligrapher
cll.note: A person or organization who writes in an artistic hand, usually as a copyist and or engrosser

ctg.name: Cartographer
ctg.note: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a map, atlas, globe, or other cartographic work

cas.name: Caster
cas.note: A person, family, or organization involved in manufacturing a resource by pouring a liquid or molten substance into a mold and leaving it to solidify to take the shape of the mold

cns.name: Censor
cns.note: A person or organization who examines bibliographic resources for the purpose of suppressing parts deemed objectionable on moral, political, military, or other grounds

chr.name: Choreographer
chr.note: A person responsible for creating or contributing to a work of movement

cng.name: Cinematographer
cng.note: A person in charge of photographing a motion picture, who plans the technical aspets of lighting and photographing of scenes, and often assists the director in the choice of angles, camera setups, and lighting moods. He or she may also supervise the further processing of filmed material up to the completion of the work print. Cinematographer is also referred to as director of photography. Do not confuse with videographer

cli.name: Client
cli.note: A person or organization for whom another person or organization is acting

cor.name: Collection registrar
cor.note: A curator who lists or inventories the items in an aggregate work such as a collection of items or works

col.name: Collector
col.note: A curator who brings together items from various sources that are then arranged, described, and cataloged as a collection. A collector is neither the creator of the material nor a person to whom manuscripts in the collection may have been addressed

clt.name: Collotyper
clt.note: A person, family, or organization involved in manufacturing a manifestation of photographic prints from film or other colloid that has ink-receptive and ink-repellent surfaces

clr.name: Colorist
clr.note: A person or organization responsible for applying color to drawings, prints, photographs, maps, moving images, etc

cmm.name: Commentator
cmm.note: A performer contributing to a work by providing interpretation, analysis, or a discussion of the subject matter on a recording, film, or other audiovisual medium

cwt.name: Commentator for written text
cwt.note: A person or organization responsible for the commentary or explanatory notes about a text. For the writer of manuscript annotations in a printed book, use Annotator

com.name: Compiler
com.note: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a new work (e.g., a bibliography, a directory) through the act of compilation, e.g., selecting, arranging, aggregating, and editing data, information, etc

cpl.name: Complainant
cpl.note: A person or organization who applies to the courts for redress, usually in an equity proceeding

cpt.name: Complainant-appellant
cpt.note: A complainant who takes an appeal from one court or jurisdiction to another to reverse the judgment, usually in an equity proceeding

cpe.name: Complainant-appellee
cpe.note: A complainant against whom an appeal is taken from one court or jurisdiction to another to reverse the judgment, usually in an equity proceeding

cmp.name: Composer
cmp.note: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating or contributing to a musical resource by adding music to a work that originally lacked it or supplements it

cmt.name: Compositor
cmt.note: A person or organization responsible for the creation of metal slug, or molds made of other materials, used to produce the text and images in printed matter

ccp.name: Conceptor
ccp.note: A person or organization responsible for the original idea on which a work is based, this includes the scientific author of an audio-visual item and the conceptor of an advertisement

cnd.name: Conductor
cnd.note: A performer contributing to a musical resource by leading a performing group (orchestra, chorus, opera, etc.) in a musical or dramatic presentation, etc.

con.name: Conservator
con.note: A person or organization responsible for documenting, preserving, or treating printed or manuscript material, works of art, artifacts, or other media

csl.name: Consultant
csl.note: A person or organization relevant to a resource, who is called upon for professional advice or services in a specialized field of knowledge or training

csp.name: Consultant to a project
csp.note: A person or organization relevant to a resource, who is engaged specifically to provide an intellectual overview of a strategic or operational task and by analysis, specification, or instruction, to create or propose a cost-effective course of action or solution

cos.name: Contestant
cos.note: A person(s) or organization who opposes, resists, or disputes, in a court of law, a claim, decision, result, etc.

cot.name: Contestant-appellant
cot.note: A contestant who takes an appeal from one court of law or jurisdiction to another to reverse the judgment

coe.name: Contestant-appellee
coe.note: A contestant against whom an appeal is taken from one court of law or jurisdiction to another to reverse the judgment

cts.name: Contestee
cts.note: A person(s) or organization defending a claim, decision, result, etc. being opposed, resisted, or disputed in a court of law

ctt.name: Contestee-appellant
ctt.note: A contestee who takes an appeal from one court or jurisdiction to another to reverse the judgment

cte.name: Contestee-appellee
cte.note: A contestee against whom an appeal is taken from one court or jurisdiction to another to reverse the judgment

ctr.name: Contractor
ctr.note: A person or organization relevant to a resource, who enters into a contract with another person or organization to perform a specific

ctb.name: Contributor
ctb.note: A person, family or organization responsible for making contributions to the resource. This includes those whose work has been contributed to a larger work, such as an anthology, serial publication, or other compilation of individual works. If a more specific role is available, prefer that, e.g. editor, compiler, illustrator

cpc.name: Copyright claimant
cpc.note: A person or organization listed as a copyright owner at the time of registration. Copyright can be granted or later transferred to another person or organization, at which time the claimant becomes the copyright holder

cph.name: Copyright holder
cph.note: A person or organization to whom copy and legal rights have been granted or transferred for the intellectual content of a work. The copyright holder, although not necessarily the creator of the work, usually has the exclusive right to benefit financially from the sale and use of the work to which the associated copyright protection applies

crr.name: Corrector
crr.note: A person or organization who is a corrector of manuscripts, such as the scriptorium official who corrected the work of a scribe. For printed matter, use Proofreader

crp.name: Correspondent
crp.note: A person or organization who was either the writer or recipient of a letter or other communication

cst.name: Costume designer
cst.note: A person, family, or organization that designs the costumes for a moving image production or for a musical or dramatic presentation or entertainment

cou.name: Court governed
cou.note: A court governed by court rules, regardless of their official nature (e.g., laws, administrative regulations)

crt.name: Court reporter
crt.note: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by preparing a court's opinions for publication

cov.name: Cover designer
cov.note: A person or organization responsible for the graphic design of a book cover, album cover, slipcase, box, container, etc. For a person or organization responsible for the graphic design of an entire book, use Book designer; for book jackets, use Bookjacket designer

cre.name: Creator
cre.note: A person or organization responsible for the intellectual or artistic content of a resource

cur.name: Curator
cur.note: A person, family, or organization conceiving, aggregating, and/or organizing an exhibition, collection, or other item

dnc.name: Dancer
dnc.note: A performer who dances in a musical, dramatic, etc., presentation

dtc.name: Data contributor
dtc.note: A person or organization that submits data for inclusion in a database or other collection of data

dtm.name: Data manager
dtm.note: A person or organization responsible for managing databases or other data sources

dte.name: Dedicatee
dte.note: A person, family, or organization to whom a resource is dedicated

dto.name: Dedicator
dto.note: A person who writes a dedication, which may be a formal statement or in epistolary or verse form

dfd.name: Defendant
dfd.note: A person or organization who is accused in a criminal proceeding or sued in a civil proceeding

dft.name: Defendant-appellant
dft.note: A defendant who takes an appeal from one court or jurisdiction to another to reverse the judgment, usually in a legal action

dfe.name: Defendant-appellee
dfe.note: A defendant against whom an appeal is taken from one court or jurisdiction to another to reverse the judgment, usually in a legal action

dgc.name: Degree committee member
dgc.note: A person who is part of a committee that considers the merit of a thesis, dissertation, or other submission by an academic degree candidate.

dgg.name: Degree granting institution
dgg.note: A organization granting an academic degree

dgs.name: Degree supervisor
dgs.note: A person overseeing a higher level academic degree

dln.name: Delineator
dln.note: A person or organization executing technical drawings from others' designs

dpc.name: Depicted
dpc.note: An entity depicted or portrayed in a work, particularly in a work of art

dpt.name: Depositor
dpt.note: A current owner of an item who deposited the item into the custody of another person, family, or organization, while still retaining ownership

dsr.name: Designer
dsr.note: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a design for an object

drt.name: Director
drt.note: A person responsible for the general management and supervision of a filmed performance, a radio or television program, etc.

dis.name: Dissertant
dis.note: A person who presents a thesis for a university or higher-level educational degree

dbp.name: Distribution place
dbp.note: A place from which a resource, e.g., a serial, is distributed

dst.name: Distributor
dst.note: A person or organization that has exclusive or shared marketing rights for a resource

dnr.name: Donor
dnr.note: A former owner of an item who donated that item to another owner

drm.name: Draftsman
drm.note: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by an architect, inventor, etc., by making detailed plans or drawings for buildings, ships, aircraft, machines, objects, etc

dub.name: Dubious author
dub.note: A person or organization to which authorship has been dubiously or incorrectly ascribed

edt.name: Editor
edt.note: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by revising or elucidating the content, e.g., adding an introduction, notes, or other critical matter. An editor may also prepare a resource for production, publication, or distribution. For major revisions, adaptations, etc., that substantially change the nature and content of the original work, resulting in a new work, see author

edc.name: Editor of compilation
edc.note: A person, family, or organization contributing to a collective or aggregate work by selecting and putting together works, or parts of works, by one or more creators. For compilations of data, information, etc., that result in new works, see compiler

edm.name: Editor of moving image work
edm.note: A person, family, or organization responsible for assembling, arranging, and trimming film, video, or other moving image formats, including both visual and audio aspects

elg.name: Electrician
elg.note: A person responsible for setting up a lighting rig and focusing the lights for a production, and running the lighting at a performance

elt.name: Electrotyper
elt.note: A person or organization who creates a duplicate printing surface by pressure molding and electrodepositing of metal that is then backed up with lead for printing

enj.name: Enacting jurisdiction
enj.note: A jurisdiction enacting a law, regulation, constitution, court rule, etc.

eng.name: Engineer
eng.note: A person or organization that is responsible for technical planning and design, particularly with construction

egr.name: Engraver
egr.note: A person or organization who cuts letters, figures, etc. on a surface, such as a wooden or metal plate used for printing

etr.name: Etcher
etr.note: A person or organization who produces text or images for printing by subjecting metal, glass, or some other surface to acid or the corrosive action of some other substance

evp.name: Event place
evp.note: A place where an event such as a conference or a concert took place

exp.name: Expert
exp.note: A person or organization in charge of the description and appraisal of the value of goods, particularly rare items, works of art, etc.

fac.name: Facsimilist
fac.note: A person or organization that executed the facsimile

fld.name: Field director
fld.note: A person or organization that manages or supervises the work done to collect raw data or do research in an actual setting or environment (typically applies to the natural and social sciences)

fmd.name: Film director
fmd.note: A director responsible for the general management and supervision of a filmed performance

fds.name: Film distributor
fds.note: A person, family, or organization involved in distributing a moving image resource to theatres or other distribution channels

flm.name: Film editor
flm.note: A person who, following the script and in creative cooperation with the Director, selects, arranges, and assembles the filmed material, controls the synchronization of picture and sound, and participates in other post-production tasks such as sound mixing and visual effects processing. Today, picture editing is often performed digitally.

fmp.name: Film producer
fmp.note: A producer responsible for most of the business aspects of a film

fmk.name: Filmmaker
fmk.note: A person, family or organization responsible for creating an independent or personal film. A filmmaker is individually responsible for the conception and execution of all aspects of the film

fpy.name: First party
fpy.note: A person or organization who is identified as the only party or the party of the first party. In the case of transfer of rights, this is the assignor, transferor, licensor, grantor, etc. Multiple parties can be named jointly as the first party

frg.name: Forger
frg.note: A person or organization who makes or imitates something of value or importance, especially with the intent to defraud

fmo.name: Former owner
fmo.note: A person, family, or organization formerly having legal possession of an item

fnd.name: Funder
fnd.note: A person or organization that furnished financial support for the production of the work

gis.name: Geographic information specialist
gis.note: A person responsible for geographic information system (GIS) development and integration with global positioning system data

hnr.name: Honoree
hnr.note: A person, family, or organization honored by a work or item (e.g., the honoree of a festschrift, a person to whom a copy is presented)

hst.name: Host
hst.note: A performer contributing to a resource by leading a program (often broadcast) that includes other guests, performers, etc. (e.g., talk show host)

his.name: Host institution
his.note: An organization hosting the event, exhibit, conference, etc., which gave rise to a resource, but having little or no responsibility for the content of the resource

ilu.name: Illuminator
ilu.note: A person providing decoration to a specific item using precious metals or color, often with elaborate designs and motifs

ill.name: Illustrator
ill.note: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by supplementing the primary content with drawings, diagrams, photographs, etc. If the work is primarily the artistic content created by this entity, use artist or photographer

ins.name: Inscriber
ins.note: A person who has written a statement of dedication or gift

itr.name: Instrumentalist
itr.note: A performer contributing to a resource by playing a musical instrument

ive.name: Interviewee
ive.note: A person, family or organization responsible for creating or contributing to a resource by responding to an interviewer, usually a reporter, pollster, or some other information gathering agent

ivr.name: Interviewer
ivr.note: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating or contributing to a resource by acting as an interviewer, reporter, pollster, or some other information gathering agent

inv.name: Inventor
inv.note: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a new device or process

isb.name: Issuing body
isb.note: A person, family or organization issuing a work, such as an official organ of the body

jud.name: Judge
jud.note: A person who hears and decides on legal matters in court.

jug.name: Jurisdiction governed
jug.note: A jurisdiction governed by a law, regulation, etc., that was enacted by another jurisdiction

lbr.name: Laboratory
lbr.note: An organization that provides scientific analyses of material samples

ldr.name: Laboratory director
ldr.note: A person or organization that manages or supervises work done in a controlled setting or environment

lsa.name: Landscape architect
lsa.note: An architect responsible for creating landscape works. This work involves coordinating the arrangement of existing and proposed land features and structures

led.name: Lead
led.note: A person or organization that takes primary responsibility for a particular activity or endeavor. May be combined with another relator term or code to show the greater importance this person or organization has regarding that particular role. If more than one relator is assigned to a heading, use the Lead relator only if it applies to all the relators

len.name: Lender
len.note: A person or organization permitting the temporary use of a book, manuscript, etc., such as for photocopying or microfilming

lil.name: Libelant
lil.note: A person or organization who files a libel in an ecclesiastical or admiralty case

lit.name: Libelant-appellant
lit.note: A libelant who takes an appeal from one ecclesiastical court or admiralty to another to reverse the judgment

lie.name: Libelant-appellee
lie.note: A libelant against whom an appeal is taken from one ecclesiastical court or admiralty to another to reverse the judgment

lel.name: Libelee
lel.note: A person or organization against whom a libel has been filed in an ecclesiastical court or admiralty

let.name: Libelee-appellant
let.note: A libelee who takes an appeal from one ecclesiastical court or admiralty to another to reverse the judgment

lee.name: Libelee-appellee
lee.note: A libelee against whom an appeal is taken from one ecclesiastical court or admiralty to another to reverse the judgment

lbt.name: Librettist
lbt.note: An author of a libretto of an opera or other stage work, or an oratorio

lse.name: Licensee
lse.note: A person or organization who is an original recipient of the right to print or publish

lso.name: Licensor
lso.note: A person or organization who is a signer of the license, imprimatur, etc

lgd.name: Lighting designer
lgd.note: A person or organization who designs the lighting scheme for a theatrical presentation, entertainment, motion picture, etc.

ltg.name: Lithographer
ltg.note: A person or organization who prepares the stone or plate for lithographic printing, including a graphic artist creating a design directly on the surface from which printing will be done.

lyr.name: Lyricist
lyr.note: An author of the words of a non-dramatic musical work (e.g. the text of a song), except for oratorios

mfp.name: Manufacture place
mfp.note: The place of manufacture (e.g., printing, duplicating, casting, etc.) of a resource in a published form

mfr.name: Manufacturer
mfr.note: A person or organization responsible for printing, duplicating, casting, etc. a resource

mrb.name: Marbler
mrb.note: The entity responsible for marbling paper, cloth, leather, etc. used in construction of a resource

mrk.name: Markup editor
mrk.note: A person or organization performing the coding of SGML, HTML, or XML markup of metadata, text, etc.

med.name: Medium
med.note: A person held to be a channel of communication between the earthly world and a world of spirits

mdc.name: Metadata contact
mdc.note: A person or organization primarily responsible for compiling and maintaining the original description of a metadata set (e.g., geospatial metadata set)

mte.name: Metal-engraver
mte.note: An engraver responsible for decorations, illustrations, letters, etc. cut on a metal surface for printing or decoration

mtk.name: Minute taker
mtk.note: A person, family, or organization responsible for recording the minutes of a meeting

mod.name: Moderator
mod.note: A performer contributing to a resource by leading a program (often broadcast) where topics are discussed, usually with participation of experts in fields related to the discussion

mon.name: Monitor
mon.note: A person or organization that supervises compliance with the contract and is responsible for the report and controls its distribution. Sometimes referred to as the grantee, or controlling agency

mcp.name: Music copyist
mcp.note: A person who transcribes or copies musical notation

msd.name: Musical director
msd.note: A person who coordinates the activities of the composer, the sound editor, and sound mixers for a moving image production or for a musical or dramatic presentation or entertainment

mus.name: Musician
mus.note: A person or organization who performs music or contributes to the musical content of a work when it is not possible or desirable to identify the function more precisely

nrt.name: Narrator
nrt.note: A performer contributing to a resource by reading or speaking in order to give an account of an act, occurrence, course of events, etc

osp.name: Onscreen presenter
osp.note: A performer contributing to an expression of a work by appearing on screen in nonfiction moving image materials or introductions to fiction moving image materials to provide contextual or background information. Use when another term (e.g., narrator, host) is either not applicable or not desired

opn.name: Opponent
opn.note: A person or organization responsible for opposing a thesis or dissertation

orm.name: Organizer
orm.note: A person, family, or organization organizing the exhibit, event, conference, etc., which gave rise to a resource

org.name: Originator
org.note: A person or organization performing the work, i.e., the name of a person or organization associated with the intellectual content of the work. This category does not include the publisher or personal affiliation, or sponsor except where it is also the corporate author

oth.name: Other
oth.note: A role that has no equivalent in the MARC list.

own.name: Owner
own.note: A person, family, or organization that currently owns an item or collection, i.e.has legal possession of a resource

pan.name: Panelist
pan.note: A performer contributing to a resource by participating in a program (often broadcast) where topics are discussed, usually with participation of experts in fields related to the discussion

ppm.name: Papermaker
ppm.note: A person or organization responsible for the production of paper, usually from wood, cloth, or other fibrous material

pta.name: Patent applicant
pta.note: A person or organization that applied for a patent

pth.name: Patent holder
pth.note: A person or organization that was granted the patent referred to by the item

pat.name: Patron
pat.note: A person or organization responsible for commissioning a work. Usually a patron uses his or her means or influence to support the work of artists, writers, etc. This includes those who commission and pay for individual works

prf.name: Performer
prf.note: A person contributing to a resource by performing music, acting, dancing, speaking, etc., often in a musical or dramatic presentation, etc. If specific codes are used, [prf] is used for a person whose principal skill is not known or specified

pma.name: Permitting agency
pma.note: An organization (usually a government agency) that issues permits under which work is accomplished

pht.name: Photographer
pht.note: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a photographic work

pad.name: Place of address
pad.note: The place to which a resource is sent, for example, the place of the postal address of a letter

ptf.name: Plaintiff
ptf.note: A person or organization who brings a suit in a civil proceeding

ptt.name: Plaintiff-appellant
ptt.note: A plaintiff who takes an appeal from one court or jurisdiction to another to reverse the judgment, usually in a legal proceeding

pte.name: Plaintiff-appellee
pte.note: A plaintiff against whom an appeal is taken from one court or jurisdiction to another to reverse the judgment, usually in a legal proceeding

plt.name: Platemaker
plt.note: A person, family, or organization involved in manufacturing a manifestation by preparing plates used in the production of printed images and/or text

pra.name: Praeses
pra.note: A person who is the faculty moderator of an academic disputation, normally proposing a thesis and participating in the ensuing disputation

pre.name: Presenter
pre.note: A person or organization mentioned in an “X presents” credit for moving image materials and who is associated with production, finance, or distribution in some way. A vanity credit; in early years, normally the head of a studio

prt.name: Printer
prt.note: A person, family, or organization involved in manufacturing a manifestation of printed text, notated music, etc., from type or plates, such as a book, newspaper, magazine, broadside, score, etc

pop.name: Printer of plates
pop.note: A person or organization who prints illustrations from plates.

prm.name: Printmaker
prm.note: A person or organization who makes a relief, intaglio, or planographic printing surface

prc.name: Process contact
prc.note: A person or organization primarily responsible for performing or initiating a process, such as is done with the collection of metadata sets

pro.name: Producer
pro.note: A person, family, or organization responsible for most of the business aspects of a production for screen, audio recording, television, webcast, etc. The producer is generally responsible for fund raising, managing the production, hiring key personnel, arranging for distributors, etc.

prn.name: Production company
prn.note: An organization that is responsible for financial, technical, and organizational management of a production for stage, screen, audio recording, television, webcast, etc.

prs.name: Production designer
prs.note: A person or organization responsible for designing the overall visual appearance of a moving image production

pmn.name: Production manager
pmn.note: A person responsible for all technical and business matters in a production

prd.name: Production personnel
prd.note: A person or organization associated with the production (props, lighting, special effects, etc.) of a musical or dramatic presentation or entertainment

prp.name: Production place
prp.note: The place of production (e.g., inscription, fabrication, construction, etc.) of a resource in an unpublished form

prg.name: Programmer
prg.note: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a computer program

pdr.name: Project director
pdr.note: A person or organization with primary responsibility for all essential aspects of a project, has overall responsibility for managing projects, or provides overall direction to a project manager

pfr.name: Proofreader
pfr.note: A person who corrects printed matter. For manuscripts, use Corrector [crr]

prv.name: Provider
prv.note: A person or organization who produces, publishes, manufactures, or distributes a resource if specific codes are not desired (e.g. [mfr], [pbl])

pup.name: Publication place
pup.note: The place where a resource is published

pbl.name: Publisher
pbl.note: A person or organization responsible for publishing, releasing, or issuing a resource

pbd.name: Publishing director
pbd.note: A person or organization who presides over the elaboration of a collective work to ensure its coherence or continuity. This includes editors-in-chief, literary editors, editors of series, etc.

ppt.name: Puppeteer
ppt.note: A performer contributing to a resource by manipulating, controlling, or directing puppets or marionettes in a moving image production or a musical or dramatic presentation or entertainment

rdd.name: Radio director
rdd.note: A director responsible for the general management and supervision of a radio program

rpc.name: Radio producer
rpc.note: A producer responsible for most of the business aspects of a radio program

rce.name: Recording engineer
rce.note: A person contributing to a resource by supervising the technical aspects of a sound or video recording session

rcd.name: Recordist
rcd.note: A person or organization who uses a recording device to capture sounds and/or video during a recording session, including field recordings of natural sounds, folkloric events, music, etc.

red.name: Redaktor
red.note: A person or organization who writes or develops the framework for an item without being intellectually responsible for its content

ren.name: Renderer
ren.note: A person or organization who prepares drawings of architectural designs (i.e., renderings) in accurate, representational perspective to show what the project will look like when completed

rpt.name: Reporter
rpt.note: A person or organization who writes or presents reports of news or current events on air or in print

rps.name: Repository
rps.note: An organization that hosts data or material culture objects and provides services to promote long term, consistent and shared use of those data or objects

rth.name: Research team head
rth.note: A person who directed or managed a research project

rtm.name: Research team member
rtm.note: A person who participated in a research project but whose role did not involve direction or management of it

res.name: Researcher
res.note: A person or organization responsible for performing research

rsp.name: Respondent
rsp.note: A person or organization who makes an answer to the courts pursuant to an application for redress (usually in an equity proceeding) or a candidate for a degree who defends or opposes a thesis provided by the praeses in an academic disputation

rst.name: Respondent-appellant
rst.note: A respondent who takes an appeal from one court or jurisdiction to another to reverse the judgment, usually in an equity proceeding

rse.name: Respondent-appellee
rse.note: A respondent against whom an appeal is taken from one court or jurisdiction to another to reverse the judgment, usually in an equity proceeding

rpy.name: Responsible party
rpy.note: A person or organization legally responsible for the content of the published material

rsg.name: Restager
rsg.note: A person or organization, other than the original choreographer or director, responsible for restaging a choreographic or dramatic work and who contributes minimal new content

rsr.name: Restorationist
rsr.note: A person, family, or organization responsible for the set of technical, editorial, and intellectual procedures aimed at compensating for the degradation of an item by bringing it back to a state as close as possible to its original condition

rev.name: Reviewer
rev.note: A person or organization responsible for the review of a book, motion picture, performance, etc.

rbr.name: Rubricator
rbr.note: A person or organization responsible for parts of a work, often headings or opening parts of a manuscript, that appear in a distinctive color, usually red

sce.name: Scenarist
sce.note: A person or organization who is the author of a motion picture screenplay, generally the person who wrote the scenarios for a motion picture during the silent era

sad.name: Scientific advisor
sad.note: A person or organization who brings scientific, pedagogical, or historical competence to the conception and realization on a work, particularly in the case of audio-visual items

aus.name: Screenwriter
aus.note: An author of a screenplay, script, or scene

scr.name: Scribe
scr.note: A person who is an amanuensis and for a writer of manuscripts proper. For a person who makes pen-facsimiles, use Facsimilist [fac]

scl.name: Sculptor
scl.note: An artist responsible for creating a three-dimensional work by modeling, carving, or similar technique

spy.name: Second party
spy.note: A person or organization who is identified as the party of the second part. In the case of transfer of right, this is the assignee, transferee, licensee, grantee, etc. Multiple parties can be named jointly as the second party

sec.name: Secretary
sec.note: A person or organization who is a recorder, redactor, or other person responsible for expressing the views of a organization

sll.name: Seller
sll.note: A former owner of an item who sold that item to another owner

std.name: Set designer
std.note: A person who translates the rough sketches of the art director into actual architectural structures for a theatrical presentation, entertainment, motion picture, etc. Set designers draw the detailed guides and specifications for building the set

stg.name: Setting
stg.note: An entity in which the activity or plot of a work takes place, e.g. a geographic place, a time period, a building, an event

sgn.name: Signer
sgn.note: A person whose signature appears without a presentation or other statement indicative of provenance. When there is a presentation statement, use Inscriber [ins].

sng.name: Singer
sng.note: A performer contributing to a resource by using his/her/their voice, with or without instrumental accompaniment, to produce music. A singer's performance may or may not include actual words

sds.name: Sound designer
sds.note: A person who produces and reproduces the sound score (both live and recorded), the installation of microphones, the setting of sound levels, and the coordination of sources of sound for a production

spk.name: Speaker
spk.note: A performer contributing to a resource by speaking words, such as a lecture, speech, etc.

spn.name: Sponsor
spn.note: A person, family, or organization sponsoring some aspect of a resource, e.g., funding research, sponsoring an event

sgd.name: Stage director
sgd.note: A person or organization contributing to a stage resource through the overall management and supervision of a performance

stm.name: Stage manager
stm.note: A person who is in charge of everything that occurs on a performance stage, and who acts as chief of all crews and assistant to a director during rehearsals

stn.name: Standards body
stn.note: An organization responsible for the development or enforcement of a standard

str.name: Stereotyper
str.note: A person or organization who creates a new plate for printing by molding or copying another printing surface

stl.name: Storyteller
stl.note: A performer contributing to a resource by relaying a creator's original story with dramatic or theatrical interpretation

sht.name: Supporting host
sht.note: A person or organization that supports (by allocating facilities, staff, or other resources) a project, program, meeting, event, data objects, material culture objects, or other entities capable of support

srv.name: Surveyor
srv.note: A person, family, or organization contributing to a cartographic resource by providing measurements or dimensional relationships for the geographic area represented

tch.name: Teacher
tch.note: A performer contributing to a resource by giving instruction or providing a demonstration

tcd.name: Technical director
tcd.note: A person who is ultimately in charge of scenery, props, lights and sound for a production

tld.name: Television director
tld.note: A director responsible for the general management and supervision of a television program

tlp.name: Television producer
tlp.note: A producer responsible for most of the business aspects of a television program

ths.name: Thesis advisor
ths.note: A person under whose supervision a degree candidate develops and presents a thesis, mémoire, or text of a dissertation

trc.name: Transcriber
trc.note: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by changing it from one system of notation to another. For a work transcribed for a different instrument or performing group, see Arranger [arr]. For makers of pen-facsimiles, use Facsimilist [fac]

trl.name: Translator
trl.note: A person or organization who renders a text from one language into another, or from an older form of a language into the modern form

tyd.name: Type designer
tyd.note: A person or organization who designs the type face used in a particular item

tyg.name: Typographer
tyg.note: A person or organization primarily responsible for choice and arrangement of type used in an item. If the typographer is also responsible for other aspects of the graphic design of a book (e.g., Book designer [bkd]), codes for both functions may be needed

uvp.name: University place
uvp.note: A place where a university that is associated with a resource is located, for example, a university where an academic dissertation or thesis was presented

vdg.name: Videographer
vdg.note: A person in charge of a video production, e.g. the video recording of a stage production as opposed to a commercial motion picture. The videographer may be the camera operator or may supervise one or more camera operators. Do not confuse with cinematographer

vac.name: Voice actor
vac.note: An actor contributing to a resource by providing the voice for characters in radio and audio productions and for animated characters in moving image works, as well as by providing voice overs in radio and television commercials, dubbed resources, etc.

wit.name: Witness
wit.note: Use for a person who verifies the truthfulness of an event or action.

wde.name: Wood engraver
wde.note: A person or organization who makes prints by cutting the image in relief on the end-grain of a wood block

wdc.name: Woodcutter
wdc.note: A person or organization who makes prints by cutting the image in relief on the plank side of a wood block

wal.name: Writer of added lyrics
wal.note: A writer of words added to an expression of a musical work. For lyric writing in collaboration with a composer to form an original work, see lyricist

wat.name: Writer of added text
wat.note: A person, family, or organization contributing to a non-textual resource by providing text for the non-textual work (e.g., writing captions for photographs, descriptions of maps).

win.name: Writer of introduction
win.note: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by providing an introduction to the original work

wpr.name: Writer of preface
wpr.note: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by providing a preface to the original work

wst.name: Writer of supplementary textual content
wst.note: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by providing supplementary textual content (e.g., an introduction, a preface) to the original work
